comments.body: This is going to fail with a TypeError on malformed input (e.g. `v0.12.x`.)  Is that acceptable?
@bnoordhuis I actually couldnâ€™t get this code to fail, it would just treat `v0.12.x` as 0 (assuming the common prefix is `v0.12.`). That seems somewhat reasonable to me.
Oh, the capture is for zero or more digits (star, not plus.)  Right, that never fails to produce a match object.  Please disregard then.
This is good, we need those `.md` extensions changed to `.html` at compile time.
Do you recall what this replacement was for?
To remove HTML comments it seems. I haven't looked into it though.

This PR also removes the capitalisation of `Contents`. That's fine with me, but I wanted to point it out in case it was not on purpose. Other occurrences uses the capitalization:

https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/7794d36a372b7cb448f5a637765a8fe2e1431d95/doc/guides/cpp-style-guide.md#L6
https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/4d3e87da3b4a8c5f369d024b10bd21a40761d381/doc/guides/releases.md#L8
https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/860c18be8786533915ff0ae8ad949c7d5404b08a/doc/guides/writing-and-running-benchmarks.md#L3

It was indeed on purpose.  [Our documentation style guide indicates the use of sentence case for document headings](https://github.com/nodejs/node/blob/835b85d5e992bc6a1b8b0a6d95068bb357d1fffc/doc/guides/doc-style-guide.md). This isn't exactly a heading (but the other things you point to are). However, the style guide also says to refer to Microsoft's style guide for things it (our style guide) doesn't cover, and [Microsoft's style guide recommends sentence case for situations like this](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/style-guide/text-formatting/using-type/use-sentence-style-capitalization).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +384,388 @@
    if (toc !== '') {
      file.toc = '<details id="toc" open><summary>Table of contents</summary>' +
        unified()
          .use(markdown)

comments.body:
Alternatively, we could rollback to `

` for the Index: ```suggestion file.toc = '

Table of contents

'; ``` It would let us revert the changes in `tools/doc/allhtml.js`, but also means the `all.html` page would not have a retractable TOC anymore.
`all.js` is the most useful place for this feature so I'm inclined to do the extra work to keep the `<details>` tag there.
